verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had launched, we came with a straight course unto Coos, and the day following unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:
verses.ct: After we had said goodbye to them and set sail, we traveled on a direct route to Cos. The next day we reached Rhodes, and from there we went on to Patara.

verses.kjv: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.
verses.ct: We found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, so we boarded it and sailed away.

verses.kjv: Now when we had discovered Cyprus, we left it on the left hand, and sailed into Syria, and landed at Tyre: for there the ship was to unlade her burden.
verses.ct: When Cyprus came into view, we passed it on our left and continued on to Syria, landing at Tyre, where the ship was scheduled to unload its cargo.

verses.kjv: And finding disciples, we tarried there seven days: who said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: We found some disciples there and stayed with them for 7 days. Through the Spirit, they urged Paul not to go to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And when we had accomplished those days, we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way, with wives and children, till we were out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore, and prayed.
verses.ct: When our time there was up, we left and continued on our journey. All of them, including their wives and children, came with us until we were outside the city. There on the beach, we knelt down and prayed.

verses.kjv: And when we had taken our leave one of another, we took ship; and they returned home again.
verses.ct: After saying our farewells to each other, we got on the ship, and they went back to their homes.

verses.kjv: And when we had finished our course from Tyre, we came to Ptolemais, and saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.
verses.ct: Completing our voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais, where we greeted the brothers and stayed with them for 1 day.

verses.kjv: And the next day we that were of Paul’s company departed, and came unto Caesarea: and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, which was one of the seven; and abode with him.
verses.ct: The next day, those of us traveling with Paul left and went to Caesarea. We went to the home of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the 7, and stayed with him.

verses.kjv: And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.
verses.ct: He had 4 unmarried daughters who prophesied.

verses.kjv: And as we tarried there many days, there came down from Judaea a certain prophet, named Agabus.
verses.ct: While we were staying there for several days, a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.

verses.kjv: And when he was come unto us, he took Paul’s girdle, and bound his own hands and feet, and said, Thus saith the Holy Ghost, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.
verses.ct: He came to us, took Paul's belt, and tied his own hands and feet with it. Then he said, "The Holy Spirit says this: 'The Jewish leaders in Jerusalem will tie up the man who owns this belt just like this, and they will hand him over to the Gentiles.'"

verses.kjv: And when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place, besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: When we heard this, both we and the local believers pleaded with Paul not to go up to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then Paul answered, What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.ct: But Paul responded, "Why are you crying and breaking my heart? I'm prepared not only to be tied up but even to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus."

verses.kjv: And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.
verses.ct: Since he wouldn't be talked out of it, we gave up and said, "Let the Lord's will be done."

verses.kjv: And after those days we took up our carriages, and went up to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: After those days, we packed our things and headed up to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea, and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.
verses.ct: Some of the disciples from Caesarea came along with us and brought us to the home of Mnason from Cyprus, a long-time disciple, where we would be staying.

verses.kjv: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.
verses.ct: When we arrived in Jerusalem, the brothers welcomed us warmly.

verses.kjv: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.
verses.ct: The following day, Paul went with us to visit James, and all the elders were there.

verses.kjv: And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.
verses.ct: After greeting them, Paul gave a detailed account of everything God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry.

verses.kjv: And when they heard it, they glorified the Lord, and said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are which believe; and they are all zealous of the law:
verses.ct: When they heard this, they praised the Lord. Then they said to him, "You can see, brother, how many thousands of Jewish people have become believers, and all of them are deeply committed to the law.

verses.kjv: And they are informed of thee, that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, saying that they ought not to circumcise their children, neither to walk after the customs.
verses.ct: They've been told about you — that you teach all the Jewish people living among the Gentiles to abandon Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children or follow the traditional customs.

verses.kjv: What is it therefore? the multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.
verses.ct: So what should we do? They will certainly hear that you've arrived.

verses.kjv: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;
verses.ct: Here's what we suggest: We have 4 men who have made a vow.

verses.kjv: Them take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges with them, that they may shave their heads: and all may know that those things, whereof they were informed concerning thee, are nothing; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest the law.
verses.ct: Take these men, go through the purification ceremony with them, and pay their expenses so they can have their heads shaved. Then everyone will know that the reports about you aren't true, and that you yourself live in obedience to the law.

verses.kjv: As touching the Gentiles which believe, we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing, save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols, and from blood, and from strangled, and from fornication.
verses.ct: As for the Gentile believers, we've already sent them a letter with our decision that they should avoid food sacrificed to idols, blood, meat from strangled animals, and sexual immorality."

verses.kjv: Then Paul took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple, to signify the accomplishment of the days of purification, until that an offering should be offered for every one of them.
verses.ct: So Paul took the men, and the next day he went through the purification ceremony with them. Then he went to the temple to give notice of when the purification period would be complete and the offering would be made for each of them.

verses.kjv: And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews which were of Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people, and laid hands on him,
verses.ct: When the 7 days were nearly over, some Jewish people from the province of Asia saw Paul in the temple. They stirred up the whole crowd and grabbed him,

verses.kjv: Crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man, that teacheth all men every where against the people, and the law, and this place: and further brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath polluted this holy place.
verses.ct: shouting, "People of Israel, help us! This is the man who teaches everyone everywhere against our people, our law, and this place. On top of that, he has brought Greeks into the temple and defiled this holy place!"

verses.kjv: (For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)
verses.ct: (They had previously seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with Paul, and they assumed Paul had brought him into the temple.)

verses.kjv: And all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they took Paul, and drew him out of the temple: and forthwith the doors were shut.
verses.ct: The whole city was thrown into chaos. People came running from everywhere. They seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple, and immediately the gates were shut.

verses.kjv: And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.
verses.ct: While they were trying to kill him, word reached the commander of the Roman garrison that all of Jerusalem was in an uproar.

verses.kjv: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions, and ran down unto them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left beating of Paul.
verses.ct: He immediately gathered soldiers and centurions and rushed down to the crowd. When the people saw the commander and his soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.

verses.kjv: Then the chief captain came near, and took him, and commanded him to be bound with two chains; and demanded who he was, and what he had done.
verses.ct: The commander came forward, arrested Paul, and ordered him to be chained with 2 chains. Then he asked who Paul was and what he had done.

verses.kjv: And some cried one thing, some another, among the multitude: and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult, he commanded him to be carried into the castle.
verses.ct: Different people in the crowd were shouting different things. Since the commander couldn't determine the facts because of all the confusion, he ordered Paul to be taken to the barracks.

verses.kjv: And when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people.
verses.ct: When Paul reached the steps, the soldiers actually had to carry him because the mob was so violent.

verses.kjv: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, Away with him.
verses.ct: The crowd kept following, shouting, "Get rid of him!"

verses.kjv: And as Paul was to be led into the castle, he said unto the chief captain, May I speak unto thee? Who said, Canst thou speak Greek?
verses.ct: Just as Paul was about to be brought into the barracks, he said to the commander, "Can I say something to you?" The commander replied, "You speak Greek?

verses.kjv: Art not thou that Egyptian, which before these days madest an uproar, and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers?
verses.ct: Aren't you that Egyptian who started a revolt some time ago and led 4,000 terrorists out into the wilderness?"

verses.kjv: But Paul said, I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus, a city in Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city: and, I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.
verses.ct: Paul answered, "I'm a Jewish man from Tarsus in Cilicia — a citizen of an important city. Please, let me speak to the people."

verses.kjv: And when he had given him licence, Paul stood on the stairs, and beckoned with the hand unto the people. And when there was made a great silence, he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue, saying,
verses.ct: The commander gave him permission, so Paul stood on the steps and motioned with his hand to the crowd. When they had quieted down, he addressed them in the Hebrew language, saying,
